intro: Cryptantha johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and narrow leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
